meta.article_title: January 21, 2019 - The Grinding Mentality - How to Play It and Against It

debutant.description: Find the weakest part of the Grinder's defense. Serve long, spinny serves that give you lots of time to follow up.
Play safe in receive, mostly, as there's no point in making an error attacking a serve when you can just push it back and look for an easier attack.

intermediaire.description: Attack the middle, roughly the playing elbow, midway between forehand and backhand, to force a weaker, erratic return.
Keep picking away at him with serves and rally shots, looking for balls you can easily attack. Don't force it; if the shot's not there, don't take it.

exercices_complementaires.description: Look to see if you can end the point on the next shot after slow looping. If not, continue playing consistent until you do get the right shot.

erreurs_a_eviter.description: Don't force low-percentage attacks. Instead, play the percentage shots as you pick away at the Grinder's defense.
